Jean Beauvoir, prolific artist of Plasmatics, Voodoo X, Little Steven and Crown Of Thorns fame is to release his first real solo album in years on Frontiers Records and ulfTone music. Entitled "Chameleon", Beauvoir could not have found a more fitting title. As diverse as the artist himself, this album features Beauvoir stepping effortlessly over stylistical borders without ever missing a beat. From the opening chords of the Lionel Richie co-write "I wanna know (incl. excerpt of "You")" to the closing lines of "Angel", Beauvoir touches the limits of musical imagination whilst retaining his strongest blessing: writing hooklines that are catchy without losing depth. After having focused on hard rock material with his own band "Crown Of Thorns", this album brings back the Beauvoir that had worldwide #1 success with the single "Feel The Heat" and the successive album "Drums Along The Mohawk" and that wrote countless hits for artists as diverse as KISS, The Ramones (including the single off the movie "School Of Rock"), N-Sync and many others; this time mixing it with state-of-the-art production and remarkable diversity in the songwriting. Jean Beauvoir is definitely back full strength with “Chameleon” which includes the following tracks: urlLink I Wanna Know (incl. excerpt from You) ; urlLink Higher ; I Don't Need Ya; Where The River Runs Deep; I Want To Lay Here; Something To Believe In; Even More; Addicted To Us; urlLink Dying End ; Teenager; Amazing; Angel. Who knows, maybe "Chameleon" will bring the long-awaited success that peers and fans have been knowing should have happened all along... Release date is scheduled for August 30th on Frontiers Records worldwide, except for Germany, Austria and Switzerland where the release will be handled via ulfTone Music/Edel.
